newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch-May 28.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch-May 28.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Wednesday morning:

** India's leading truckmaker Tata Engineering & Locomotive Company (TELCO) on Tuesday beat market expectations when it announced a whopping 44 percent increase in net profit for the year ended March 31, 1997.
TELCO said its net profit surged to 7.62 billion rupees in 1996/97 (April-March), from 5.3 billion in the previous year.
Shares of TELCO jumped 11 rupees, or nearly three percent, to 404 in after-hours kerb deals in Bombay. The stock had closed 7.0 rupees lower at 393 in official trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

** The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has projected a very healthy outlook for the balance of payments in 1997-98 and targetted the current account deficit at 1.4 percent of gross domestic product compared with one percent recorded in the last fiscal year, the Business Standard reports.

** The paper quoted senior RBI officials as saying the targets for the year include a 15 percent growth in exports, a 10 percent increase in imports and a sizeable jump in foreign exchange reserves (currently estimated at over $23 billion).
** TELCO shares are seen higher at start after the company posted a net profit higher than market expectations.
** Indian Shaving on Wednesday reported a 1996/97 (April-March) net profit of 51.5 million rupees against 36.6 million last year.
** Hero Honda announced a higher net profit of 503.6 million rupees in 1996/97 compared to 263.4 million in the year-ago period.
** India's largest steel maker Steel Authority of India (SAIL), multinational Colgate Palmolive Ltd and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL) are due to announce 1996/97 results later on Wednesday.
** The Indian rupee opened Wednesday at 35.825/835 per dollar, little changed from Tuesday's close of 35.825/830, dealers said.
The rupee is seen trading between 35.82 and 35.85 per dollar on Tuesday, they said.
** Indian shares closed broadly lower on Tuesday after an early rally attracted profit-booking, traders said.
** Bombay's benchmark stocks index .BSESN ended 9.10 points down at 3,692.55.
